text: The Democratic Progressive Party (DPP) (Traditional Chinese: ; Simplified Chinese: ; abbreviated to or ; Pinyin: Mínjìndǎng) is a major political party in the Republic of China (Taiwan). The party has been linked with the pan- green coalition and de jure Taiwan independence movement. The DPP is a member of Liberal International and a founding member of the Council of Asian Liberals and Democrats. The DPP represented Taiwan in the Unrepresented Nations and Peoples Organisation. == List of Chairpersons == # Chiang Peng- chian (1986–1987) # Yao Chia-wen (1987–1988) # Huang Shin-cheih (1988–1992) # Hsu Hsin-liang (1992–1994, 1996–1998) # Shih Ming-teh (1994–1996) # Lin Yi- hsiung (1998–2000) # Frank Hsieh (2000) # Chen Shui-bian (2000–2008) # Tsai Ing-wen (since 2008) == References == == Other websites == * Official website Category:Political parties in Taiwan Category:Liberal parties Category:Social democratic parties in Asia Category:Nationalist organizations in Taiwan Category:1986 establishments in Asia Category:1980s establishments in Taiwan
title: Democratic Progressive Party
